derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin raritas, from rarus 'far apart, infrequently found' (see rare)

entry.tran: 罕见的人（或物）；奇物;珍品
entry.def: If someone or something is a rarity, they are interesting or valuable because they are so unusual.

example.ex: Motorized wheelchairs are a rarity here...
example.tran: 电动轮椅在这里很罕见。

example.ex: He was a rarity among Wall Street lawyers...
example.tran: 他在华尔街的律师当中是个奇人。

entry.def: The rarity of something is the fact that it is very uncommon.

example.ex: This indicates the rarity of such attacks...
example.tran: 这显示出这种疾病发作的罕见性。

example.ex: It was a real prize due to its rarity and good condition...
example.tran: 因为稀有并且品相完好，它价值连城。

means.word_mean: 3. something unusual -- perhaps worthy of collecting
